body: Please try to set up an environment variable, `ONNX_ML=1`, and reinstall onnx python package. There are two versions of ONNX format. The default one doesn't contain enough types to support machine learning pipelines.
I have this same issue, and the solution didnt work...anyone else?

Please try reinstall ONNX python packages after setting `ONNX_ML=1`.  If you are using windows command line, please open your cmd.exe and then do

1. C:\Users\UserName>`set ONNX_ML=1`
2. C:\Users\UserName>`pip install -I onnx` or `pip install -I git+https://github.com/onnx/onnx`
3. C:\Users\UserName>`pip install -I onnxmltools`

This should work under Window `Anaconda Prompt`, too.

issue.title: AttributeError: 'TypeProto' object has no attribute 'sequence_type'

repository.name: sklearn-onnx
repository.description: Convert scikit-learn models and pipelines to ONNX

issue.body:
I'm follwing the example from the documentation.

```python
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

from skl2onnx import convert_sklearn
from skl2onnx.common.data_types import FloatTensorType

iris = load_iris()
X, y = iris.data, iris.target

X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y)

clf = RandomForestClassifier()
clf.fit(X_train, y_train)

initial_type = [('float_input', FloatTensorType([1, 4]))]
onx = convert_sklearn(clf, initial_types=initial_type)
with open("model.onnx", "wb") as f:
    f.write(onx.SerializeToString())
```
And i'm getting an AttributeError.
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "iris.py", line 17, in <module>
    onx = convert_sklearn(clf, initial_types=initial_type)
  File "C:\Users\u0306\Anaconda3\envs\onnx-tests\lib\site-packages\skl2onnx\convert.py", line 78, in convert_sklearn
    onnx_model = convert_topology(topology, name, doc_string, target_opset)
  File "C:\Users\u0306\Anaconda3\envs\onnx-tests\lib\site-packages\skl2onnx\common\_topology.py", line 708, in convert_topology
    container.add_output(other_outputs[name])
  File "C:\Users\u0306\Anaconda3\envs\onnx-tests\lib\site-packages\skl2onnx\common\_container.py", line 152, in add_output
    self.outputs.append(self._make_value_info(variable))
  File "C:\Users\u0306\Anaconda3\envs\onnx-tests\lib\site-packages\skl2onnx\common\_container.py", line 133, in _make_value_info
    value_info.type.CopyFrom(variable.type.to_onnx_type())
  File "C:\Users\u0306\Anaconda3\envs\onnx-tests\lib\site-packages\skl2onnx\common\data_types.py", line 135, in to_onnx_type
    onnx_type.sequence_type.elem_type.CopyFrom(self.element_type.to_onnx_type())
AttributeError: 'TypeProto' object has no attribute 'sequence_type'
```

body:

I have also tried reinstalling onnxmltools both from pip and source, after setting up the environment variable.
What's your OS? Could you provide more details like printing out your environment variables?

```bash
AttributeError: 'TypeProto' object has no attribute 'sequence_type'

```

There are some warnings but I don't think that they are about the error.

Lastly, this is the code that I'm trying to execute:

```python
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from onnxmltools import convert_sklearn
from onnxmltools.convert.common.data_types import FloatTensorType

iris = load_iris()
X, y = iris.data, iris.target
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y)

clr = LogisticRegression()
clr.fit(X_train, y_train)
print(clr)


initial_type = [('float_input', FloatTensorType([1, 4]))]
onx = convert_sklearn(clr, initial_types=initial_type)
with open("logreg_iris.onnx", "wb") as f:
    f.write(onx.SerializeToString())
```

I must be doing something wrong but I am not seeing it!

Looks like you're using anaconda, so there could be multiple different python environments. Are you sure that `pip` and `python` are associated to the same environment? Could you print out the package installation paths and the module paths imported in your script?

Thank you for your time.

Both pip and conda are indeed associated to the same environment:

```
(onnx) XXX@ubuntu:/var/opt/MLFramework Test/onnx$ which python
/home/XXX/.miniconda/envs/onnx/bin/python
(onnx) XXX@ubuntu:/var/opt/MLFramework Test/onnx$ which pip
/home/XXX/.miniconda/envs/onnx/bin/pip
(onnx) XXX@ubuntu:/var/opt/MLFramework Test/onnx$ python -c "import site; print(site.getsitepackages())"
['/home/XXX/.miniconda/envs/onnx/lib/python3.7/site-packages']
```
Inside the packages site are these packages (I'm excludiong those that are not the ones I used in the script besides the ones related to onnx):

```
(onnx) XXX@ubuntu:/var/opt/MLFramework Test/onnx$ ls /home/XXX/.miniconda/envs/onnx/lib/python3.7/site-packages -lha
{...}
drwxrwxr-x  14 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 21 09:39 onnx
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 21 09:39 onnx-1.4.1.dist-info
drwxrwxr-x   6 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 21 09:39 onnxmltools
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 21 09:39 onnxmltools-1.3.1.dist-info
drwxrwxr-x   7 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 09:27 onnxruntime
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 09:27 onnxruntime-0.2.1.dist-info
drwxrwxr-x   3 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 onnxtk
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 onnxtk-0.0.1.dist-info
{...}
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 09:28 scikit_learn-0.20.2.dist-info
drwxrwxr-x   7 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 scikitonx
drwxrwxr-x  22 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 scipy
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 scipy-1.2.1.dist-info
{...}
drwxrwxr-x   7 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 skl2onnx
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:16 skl2onnx-1.4.2.dist-info
drwxrwxr-x  29 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 09:28 sklearn
{...}
drwxrwxr-x   6 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:17 tf2onnx
drwxrwxr-x   2 XXX XXX 4,0K feb 20 12:17 tf2onnx-0.3.2.dist-info
{...}
```

By the way, if I install though pip I need to use `onnxmltools.convert.common.data_types` while if I  install through source it requires `skl2onnx.common.data_types`. Is this normal? Which version is the more robust one?

The latest ONNX package already has ONNX_ML==1 set by default, please have a try.
There are some recent changes that sklearn converter has separated from onnxmltools so the answer is skl2onnx.common.data_types.

In the end, I was trying to test other ways to deploy models, and I installed onnx from anaconda by chance. With this onnx version, the script executed correctly.

It´s a pitty that I'm not 100% sure if it was the onnx version or another thing, but I got it to work by installing onnx through:
```bash 
 conda install -y -c conda-forge onnx
```

issue.title: Unsupported splitting criterion error in convert_lightgbm

repository.name: onnxmltools
repository.description: ONNXMLTools enables conversion of models to ONNX

issue.body:
Hi 

I am facing below error          
`ValueError: Unsupported splitting criterion: %s. Only <=, <, >=, and > are allowed.`     
while converting my LGBMClassifier model to ONNX.  

Python - 3.7.1 installed through Anaconda on Mac
ONNX installed through `conda install -y -c conda-forge onnx`      
onnxmltools & onnxruntime installed through pip      

Any idea what is causing this error and how to resolve it?       
Does sklearn API of lightgbm is not supported for converting to onnx?
